info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 13 at 2:40AM PDT until August 14 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HOT...DRY...WINDY...AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS EXPECTED THIS UPCOMING WEEK... .A strong ridge will build in over the region beginning today, with temperatures expected to rise well into the triple digits for most locations west of the Cascades. Dry air will produce low afternoon humidities, and when combined with afternoon and evening winds, critical fire weather conditions are possible. Additionally, dry and unstable conditions could lead to rapid fire growth at the Flat Fire or any other active fires in the area. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR STRONG GUSTY WIND AND LOW RH FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 280... * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended. * AFFECTED AREA...In California...Fire weather zone 280, including Happy Camp, Seiad Valley, Scott Bar, Fort Jones, Etna, Sawyers Bar, and portions of the Klamath National Forest. * WIND...Northwest around 10 mph with gusts up to 20 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent. * ADDITIONAL INFO...View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: If you have not packed your evacuation kit yet, now is the time to do so. This includes items like important documents and essentials you cannot live without. Fill your vehicle`s fuel tank. Visit ready.gov/kit for more information. Plan now to avoid using equipment that could cause sparks during the period when critical weather conditions are possible. Visit weather.gov/medford/wildfire for links to fire restrictions in your area. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible during the valid watch time. These conditions could promote the rapid spread of wildfires which could become life- threatening. Check weather.gov/medford for forecast updates and a possible upgrade of the this watch to a Red Flag Warning.
